ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Kelin the dubiously talented song writer
ygData.msgSnippet: It s not Kelin s fault ;-) Back in last August both these songs worked quite well.  Lullaby actually mezzed things.  Now against high blues, whites, and
ygData.messageBody:
It's not Kelin's fault ;-)

Back in last August both these songs worked quite well. Lullaby actually
mezzed things. Now against high blues, whites, and yellows it is suicide.
Thanks Verant.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Sunski [mailto:sunski@...]
Sent: Tuesday, July 11, 2000 3:33 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: [eqbards] Kelin the dubiously talented song writer


Just who was this Kelin anyway? Some sort of sado-masochist?

Hello, I've been a lurker for a little while. Now I'm having a bit of a
problem figuring out what to do
with Kelin's Lucid Lullaby. I know there's been a lot of discussion on the
list about this song, but
usually in relation to levels far above mine. I've been meaning to write
this since I got the darn song,
because I just can't figure out how to use it.

First, my experience with Kelin's Lugubrious Lament. When I first got that
song it didn't work for me at
all. Always resisted. Consistently got mobbed. But as I've leveled, it's
become more useful. I really
only try to use it on blues and I'm having a very good success rate (knock
on wood).

Then I get Lullaby and it's even worse than Lament was when I first got it
because I can't see when it
"hits" them -- I'm just all of a sudden surrounded. I pick a small group of
blues. Run up and turn on
Lullaby. Nothing. No "resist" message. No "sleepy/whatever" message.
Then they're all wailing away on
me.

Can someone tell me if I'm doing something wrong or if this song just really
sucks that bad? Should I
wait a couple (more) levels to start trying to use it? But then I thought I
recalled from previous
discussion that it's completely useless after level 24? or 27? So why
bother for just a few levels of
use?

Thanks for any advice.
Lyressa - level 17
Nameless

p.s. If I ever run into that Kelin I'm going to have to give him a piece of
my mind. Or maybe my foot --
soundly on the butt.
